result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Mayotte

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:05 pm.

INCLUDES 22CM710, 22CF561 & 22CF578. NON-WAIVABLE No contact with victim(s): L.M.B., residence, K.C.Z or residence (waiveable).  No Contact with victim(s):  K.L.G., N.L.O. or their residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   No possession or use of firearms or dangerous weapons.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
